Editors’ Picks
AUD/USD loses its recovery momentum near 0.6830 as Dollar rebounds
[]https://www.fxstreet.com/currencies/audusd
The AUD/USD loses its recovery momentum during the early Asian session on Friday. The US Dollar bounces off the lowest level since July near 100.85 and then recovers to 101.25. The pair trades around 0.6830, down 0.02% on the day.
AUD/USD News
EUR/USD consolidates losses below 1.1100
[]https://www.fxstreet.com/currencies/eurusd
EUR/USD retreated from five-month highs and failed to hold above 1.1100. The pair found support above 1.1050 and is hovering around 1.1060. The US Dollar gained momentum amid a rebound in US Treasury yields.
EUR/USD News
Gold declines below $2,080 as US yields edge higher
[]https://www.fxstreet.com/markets/commodities/metals/gold
Gold lost its traction and fell below $2,080 after rising toward $2,090 in the early European session. The modest recovery seen in US Treasury bond yields ahead doesn't allow XAU/USD to preserve its bullish momentum.
Gold News
XRP price holds above $0.6 as US politicians coalesce to fire SEC Chair Gary Gensler
[]https://www.fxstreet.com/cryptocurrencies/news/ripple-price-to-extend-consolidation-before-next-bold-move-as-xrp-fills-up-a-triangle-202312282100
Ripple price is holding above the $0.6000 support level as crypto proponents double down on the battle against the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and its chair, Gary Gensler. In the latest, US Congressman Tom Emmer has co-signed a “Stabilization Bill” to fire Gensler.

S&P 500 ends Thursday within ten points of all-time highs near $4,800
[]https://www.fxstreet.com/news/sp-500-ends-thursday-within-ten-points-of-all-time-highs-near-4-800-202312282246
The S&P 500 large-cap equity index came within ten points of posting new all-time highs on Friday before getting dragged back after a surprise bump in Treasury yields following a 7-year T-note auction that splashed water on the market’s ongoing risk rally fueled by rate cut expectations in 2024.
